author: Hearst Television Inc.
title: Weather: Summer Weather Friday
text: Weather: Summer Weather Friday We get another taste of late summer weather as temperatures rise into the 80s Weather: Summer Weather Friday We get another taste of late summer weather as temperatures rise into the 80s TOMORROW. YEAH, WE’RE GOING TO GET BACK INTO THE 80S NOW. HOW MANY MORE 80S ARE WE GOING TO HAVE AFTER TOMORROW? ZERO ZERO. OKAY. THERE YOU GO. DEBBIE DOWNER OVER HERE. WELL, YOU KNOW, WE’LL SEE HOW IT HAPPENS. BUT TYPICALLY SOMETIME AROUND THIS TIME OF THE YEAR, WE START TO SEE PRETTY MUCH WRAPPING UP THE 80S. NOW, AT LEAST ENJOY IT FOR TOMORROW. GET OUT. WE’LL HAVE THOSE NICE SOUTHERLY WINDS COMING IN HERE SATURDAY THOUGH. COLD FRONT MOVES IN AND COOLS US OFF. MAYBE A STRAY RAIN SHOWER BOTH SATURDAY AND SUNDAY, AND THEN A MUCH COOLER START ON MONDAY. NEXT WEEK’S WORKWEEK WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 50S, 66 RIGHT NOW IN ROAD AMERICA. ELKHART LAKE A BEAUTIFUL AND SUNNY AFTERNOON. WE’VE GOT DOWN TOWARDS DELAVAN AND VERY SIMILAR CONDITIONS AND A LITTLE BIT WARMER. 75 DEGREES ENJOYABLE TO BE JUST DOING A LITTLE BIT OF SOME GOLFING, TENNIS, A BIKE RIDE, YOU NAME IT. THE WEATHER’S BEEN PRETTY NICE SO FAR THIS FALL. MID 60S ALONG THE LAKESHORE WITH THAT EAST TO SOUTHEAST WIND COMPONENT. BUT IF YOU’RE AWAY FROM THE LAKE, YOU HAVE SEEN THOSE SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPERATURES IN THE LOWER AND MID 70S. NOW, AS WE HEAD INTO TOMORROW, WINDS WILL CHANGE OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST. AND THAT’S GOING TO BUMP THOSE TEMPERATURES UP FOR EVERYBODY AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT. AND THEN WE COOL OFF INTO THE 60S SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. LOOK AT MONDAY AND TUESDAY. THESE WILL BE THE COOLEST DAYS OF THE WORKWEEK. BUT WE’LL START TO GRADUALLY WARM UP INTO THE MID 60S. NORMAL HIGHS AS WE HEAD INTO TOMORROW IS 63 DEGREES. SO WE’RE RUNNING NEAR 20 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR TOMORROW. HERE’S OUR NEXT WEATHER MAKER THAT’S OFF TOWARDS THE WEST. WE’LL BE WATCHING A COLD FRONT THAT MOVES EASTWARD AND THAT’S GOING TO DRAW IN SOME OF THOSE COOLER TEMPERATURES. BUT BEFORE THAT HAPPENS, LOOK AHEAD OF THAT FRONT. HIGHS NEAR 90 DEGREES AND PIERCE NORTH PLATTE 88 DEGREES. WE’VE GOT INTERNATIONAL FALLS AT 7582 IN DES MOINES. THAT’S MOVING THIS WAY AS WE HEAD INTO OUR FRIDAY FORECAST. SO TOMORROW WE’LL WAKE UP IN THE MID AND UPPER 50S, A COOL START, BUT WITH THAT SUNSHINE IT WILL FEEL EVEN WARMER. AND THEN LOOK HOW THAT WARMTH EXPLODES. HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S AND LOW 90S IN PARTS OF THE PLAINS EXTENDING UP TOWARDS PARTS OF IOWA. GETTING INTO THE LOWER 80S ACROSS SOUTHEAST WISCONSIN. BUT THAT WARMTH AND MOVES DOWN TO THE SOUTH ONCE THE COLD FRONT PUSHES THROUGH. HIGHS STRUGGLING TO GET INTO THE LOWER 60S. HERE’S WHAT FUTURECAST IS SHOWING AS WE HEAD INTO TOMORROW. WE’LL HAVE THAT COLD FRONT MAKE ITS WAY DOWN TO THE SOUTHEAST, BUT IT WON’T ARRIVE UNTIL LATE TOMORROW NIGHT. EARLY SATURDAY, SO BEFORE THAT HAPPENS, HOPEFULLY YOU’LL BE ABLE TO ENJOY THAT FORECAST. TOMORROW, 82 FOR THE HIGH NEAR 20 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. AND THEN WE GO BACK INTO THE 60S. SATURDAY AND SUNDAY MIGHT HAVE A STRAY RAIN SHOWER SATURDAY, AND ALSO ON SUNDAY IT’S STARTING TO DRY OUT AS WE HEAD IN TOWARDS OUR MONDAY. MAYBE A SPRINKLE, BUT LOOKS LIKE MORE CLEARING SKIES AS WE HEAD TOWARDS TUESDAY WITH HIGHS IN THE M Advertisement Weather: Summer Weather Friday We get another taste of late summer weather as temperatures rise into the 80s Temperatures will warm into the upper 70s and lower 80s as we wrap up the work week. These temperatures will be as much as 20 degrees above normal for this time of year.A cold front will move into the area Saturday which will drop our high temperatures down into the 60s and that will continue into Sunday as well. We could see some light showers both days and maybe sprinkles on Monday. MILWAUKEE — Temperatures will warm into the upper 70s and lower 80s as we wrap up the work week. These temperatures will be as much as 20 degrees above normal for this time of year. Advertisement A cold front will move into the area Saturday which will drop our high temperatures down into the 60s and that will continue into Sunday as well. We could see some light showers both days and maybe sprinkles on Monday.
